text:
3 tips for those who are too forgetful
06 Nov 2019, 22:00 by Lifehacker and Bombora Publishing House
Excerpt from the book of the Japanese neurosurgeon Takashi Tsukiyama ‚ÄúForgetfulness is my second ... something there‚Äù about brain problems associated with modern life.
Make information easier to remember
First, try to remember often what you want to remember. For example, if every time you see someone‚Äôs face, you will remember the name of that person, then in the end then it will immediately pop up in your memory by itself.
The second method is grouping information. There is a phenomenon called the magic number seven. Its essence is that a person can simultaneously memorize a limited number of information elements, for example, words or numbers. Someone can remember 7, someone only 3, on average this number is 5 ¬± 2. If the elements of information are greater than this value, then the person forgets it. It turns out that the amount of data that we can easily remember is very limited.
But if you group the information, you can remember much more.
For example, if you are told to remember the names of all professional baseball players, you are unlikely to be able to do this. The task becomes feasible if you group them. For example, first we divide everyone into two leagues: Pacific and Central. Then we'll see which teams make up these leagues. Then you can remember the names of team infilders. If all the names are grouped in this way, we can remember more of them, and remembering them will also be easier.
The third method is to create as many ‚Äúclues‚Äù as possible so that it is easier to remember. For example, if you always meet people in the same office, it will be more difficult for you to remember who is who among them. But if you change the venue, you can remember: "This is the person we met there." The place will become a clue for memory. It will be even easier for you to remember a person if you connect other facts to this. For example, about what you did together, or what you presented to him, etc.
To easily retrieve information from memory, it is extremely important to use one of these tricks. It is not surprising that you cannot recall something if you have not used any of these methods.
Our brain is designed so that it tries to remember everything that we saw and heard (that is why we sometimes suddenly remember what we thought we had long forgotten). But if we do not use the cognitive functions of the brain during the storage of information, then we will not be able to immediately extract it from memory when we want.
Get rid of brain freezes
[...] Has memory failed again? It's okay, write down in a notebook in detail what exactly you could not remember. Try to remember it all the same or find some information about what you forgot. Next time, make every effort so that new similar information does not fly out of your head. This measure alone will not make the symptoms worse. If you don‚Äôt make yourself such ‚Äúhints‚Äù, you will simply close your eyes to the fact that you have forgotten something again, and you will even forget the fact that it happened.
The second thing you need to do is practice talking for a long time. Let your family help you with this. Your goal is not just to lead a long story, but to ask your interlocutor to ask clarifying questions and to speak in detail precisely those moments that you are unusual to discuss, which are not brought to automaticity. At first, it will be difficult for you to express your thoughts in a harmonious way, there will be pauses in the story every now and then, but this is the training of creating new ‚Äúadd-ons‚Äù and maintaining the conditions where they may arise.
I seem to be writing about obvious things. But it is the obvious things, as a rule, that suddenly disappear from our lives. If you compensate for ‚Äúsomething‚Äù that you stopped doing, then you will go on the mend. After all, just reading out loud or doing arithmetic exercises is not a panacea.
It‚Äôs also very useful to do something new. You can go to study that is far from your specialty, start going to interesting courses, learn something new from family members. For those who are constantly in the position of a teacher, it is sometimes useful to leave the familiar chair of the teacher and become a student. This will make it possible to find something new in the familiar and look at things from a different angle.
Ultimately, the youth of the brain is determined by how much a person has interests, how often he has to solve intellectual problems, and how much his life is filled with new ones.
The brain of a person who has a lot of this in life always remains ‚Äúyoung‚Äù at any age. And vice versa, the brain of young people, deprived of such a variety in life, can quickly ‚Äúage‚Äù. We can say that the ‚Äúyouth‚Äù of the brain depends only on the number of new tasks. Everyone who faces brain freezes must definitely make their lives more diverse.
Overcome Internet Addiction
People with Internet addiction often complain that they are not that they are worse at remembering, but rather are worse at remembering. At the beginning of the book, I already wrote about the causes and consequences of this phenomenon: if a person has at hand a convenient device that will perform some functions for him, then he will surely transfer these tasks to him.
A person does not try to remember something diligently, but replaces this process with a simple search on the Internet. The ability to retrieve information from memory is lost. And when a person has a rare opportunity to remember something himself, he cannot do this and feels ‚Äúfreezing‚Äù. [...]
In the fight against Internet addiction, there is one caveat: the Internet is always at hand. The fact is that when treating any addiction, the patient is first of all excluded from what causes it. In the case of the Internet, this is difficult to do, because you need it both for work and for communication.
Then an effective way would be to remove the first stage of entering the virtual world.
For example, if a person has a habit, when he comes to work, he immediately sits down at a computer and checks mail, and then browses different sites to infinity, then you need to get rid of it. As soon as a person begins to "sit" on the Internet, his attention adapts to web surfing. The emotional system perceives this as something pleasant, and it becomes more and more difficult to stop. The very process of turning on the computer and browsing the mail is just part of the usual actions. Therefore, from the point of view of the properties of the brain, it is easiest to get rid of it.
When you do this, and instead of the usual actions, you have to immediately take on the boring work, you will probably want to return everything back. To prevent this, it is necessary to give pleasure to the emotional system in other ways. Take a break from the computer and drink delicious coffee or do something else enjoyable.
After working for many hours at the computer, you should definitely go for a walk or somehow provide your eyes with a warm-up. So the brain can switch and use its other functions.



Read about other common brain problems and examples of dealing with them in the book ‚ÄúForgetfulness is my second ... something there. How to return what constantly flies out of my head. ‚Äù It will be useful to everyone who forgets the names of acquaintances, has difficulty concentrating on work or is experiencing a creative crisis.
